quizzes.question:
Fill in the blank to search ''boxes'' in the ''name'' column of the ''items'' table.
[!raw!]
SELECT seller_id FROM items
WHERE name {0} '%boxes'
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The Like Operator[/h1]

The [b]LIKE [/b]keyword is useful when specifying a [b]search condition[/b] within your WHERE clause.[code format="sql"]SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name [b]LIKE pattern[/b];[/code]
SQL [b]pattern [/b]matching enables you to use "_" to match any single character and "%" to match an arbitrary number of characters (including zero characters).

For example, to select employees whose [i]FirstNames [/i]begin with the letter [b]A[/b], you would use the following query:[code format="sql"]SELECT * FROM employees 
WHERE FirstName [b]LIKE 'A%'[/b];[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2827" width="100%"]
As another example, the following SQL query selects all employees with a [i]LastName [/i]ending with the letter "s":[code format="sql"]SELECT * FROM employees 
WHERE LastName [b]LIKE '%s'[/b];[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2828" width="100%"]
[note]The % wildcard can be used [b]multiple[/b] times within the same pattern.[/note]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to complete the statement, which selects ''name'' and minimum of the "cost'' from ''items'', filtering by name and seller id.
[!raw!]
SELECT name, {0}(cost) 
FROM items WHERE name 
{1} '%boxes of frogs' AND 
seller_id {2} (68, 6, 18)
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The MIN Function[/h1]

The [b]MIN [/b]function is used to return the minimum value of an expression in a SELECT statement.

For example, you might wish to know the minimum salary among the employees. [code format="sql"]SELECT [b]MIN[/b](Salary) AS Salary FROM employees;[/code]
[img id="2829" width="100%"]
[note]All of the SQL functions can be combined together to create a single expression.[/note]
